comment._content: It's still there ... the inscription continues - Carol, what I think you are reading as "1870" is probably "1850" - cranneyanthony's version shows it clearer!

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: I think it might be "H. Fulton M.E." based on the colour pic above and I've found a Henry T Fulton, Architect & Surveyor in Bangor in 1901 www.census.nationalarchives.ie/pages/1901/Down/Bangor/Duf... and this entry in the DIA www.dia.ie/architects/view/2049 Only problem is his age (31 in 1901) which would make him only 13 in 1883, the latest date for this photo, and probably not a Master of Engineering! Although it could also be this Henry Fulton, also an architect, who died in 1859 www.dia.ie/architects/view/1522/FULTON-HENRY EDIT: Just noticed the 1850 date so that definitely rules out the first one but allows the second one.

comment.author: 8214568@N08

comment.author: 86136754@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] as you go out of Rostrevor towards kilkeel on the the left is kilbroney park you can drive up to the carpark and walk the the last few hundred yards up to the Big Stone and enjoy the view over Carlingford bay!

comment.author: 51588910@N08
comment._content:
Yes, not far from here - in the 1960's and 70's it was part of a family ritual to walk from Warrenpoint to the big stone (mostly at Easter and weather permitting Christmas) back then you walked up via the "Fiddlers Green" a path that still exists although these days most people take a car up to the top car park (still a bit  of a walk though) 

Over the years it has suffered a lot at the hands of local graffiti artists and indeed been repainted a number of times in different shades from yellow and black, to pink with purple spots and everything in between.

comment.author: 51588910@N08
comment._content: I'm no Photoshop expert, but I was able to pull some detail from the background - you may need to click on the small magnifying glass bottom right of the picture a few times to enlarge it. i260.photobucket.com/albums/ii35/oldwarrenpointforum/admi...
